p: Zein is a protein present in corn with a molecular weight ranging between 22 and 27 kDa and an isoelectric point of 6.2 with high solubility in aqueous alcohol solutions [ 36, 37]. This protein has a high proportion of nonpolar amino acids which are responsible for the solubility behavior of zein [ 38]. This water-insoluble protein is classified as GRAS by the US Food and Drug Administration and is widely used in food [ 39]. This biodegradable and biocompatible protein has been used as a vehicle for the delivery of active compounds (e.g., enzymes, drugs, and essential oils) [ 39, 40, 41, 42, 43].
